brain_cache.rule: Rewards must be strictly utilitarian. XP is not a score; it is currency to buy 'Equipment' (Active Buffs) that make the next 'Boss' (Task) mathematically easier.
brain_cache.trigger: Designing the Shop or Level-Up Rewards
brain_cache.verification: Can the user buy an item that extends a deadline by 10%? If yes, the loop is closed.
brain_cache.red_flag: XP is used only for cosmetic badges or leaderboard ranking.

brain_cache.rule: The AI must act as a 'Stateless Judge'. It does not care about user feelings or excuses. It only evaluates: Input vs. Constraint.
brain_cache.trigger: Prompting the LLM for task verification
brain_cache.verification: User: 'I did 14 pushups in 60s (target 15)'. AI Response: 'DEFEAT. Stake Lost.' (No encouragement).

brain_cache.rule: Users cannot simply 'start' a hard task. They must 'Traverse the Fog'â€”pay an upfront HP cost to attempt it. This creates 'Loss Aversion' immediately.
brain_cache.verification: A modal appears: 'Cost to Attempt: 5 HP. Reward: 100 XP. Proceed?'
brain_cache.red_flag: User can spam-click 'Start' on hard tasks with zero risk.

brain_cache.rule: Remove all linear progress bars for single tasks. A task is a boolean state: 0 (Alive/Incomplete) or 1 (Dead/Complete).
brain_cache.verification: Task card has no '50% done' slider. It has a 'Submit Proof' button only.
